CONJUGATES: corporals (plural, noun) | more corporal (comparative, adj) | most corporal (superlative, adj)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French corporel, derived from Latin corporalis 'relating to the body,' from corpus 'body.'

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Relating to or belonging to the human body; physical.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Corporal punishment, involving physical pain, is banned in many schools.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 涉及身体痛苦的体罚在许多学校被禁止。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A non-commissioned officer rank in the army, air force, or marine corps, typically ranking above a private and below a sergeant.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 下士（军队中的军衔，高于列兵，低于中士）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He was promoted to corporal after serving two years in the infantry.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他在步兵服役两年后被提升为下士。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A square cloth of white linen used in the celebration of the Eucharist, on which the consecrated elements are placed.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 圣体布（天主教弥撒中，用于放置圣体和圣血容器的方形白麻布）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The acolyte helped the priest prepare the altar, including unfolding the corporal.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 辅祭者帮助神父准备祭坛，包括展开圣体布。
